intro: Theobroma calodesme, commonly known as the chocolate tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are used in the production of cocoa. Theobroma calodesme plays an important role in both ecological systems and the chocolate industry.
